alert.note: Alert for Cameron (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 30 at 4:42PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Deep South Texas, including the following county, Cameron. * WHEN...Until 515 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 440 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Urban and small stream flooding is imminent or occurring. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cameron Park, Downtown Brownsville, Southmost, Brownsville, Lincoln Park, Brownsville Fire Department Station Six, Hanna High School, B I S D Administration Building, Northside Transfer Station, Gonzalez Elementary School, Brownsville Event Center, Martin Elementary School, Gallegos Elementary School, Perkins Middle School, Brownsville Golf Center, Sunrise Mall, Stell Middle School, Dean Porter Park, J.t. Canales Elementary School and Gladys Porter Zoo. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
